title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The current code in the win32 implementation of BidiUtil uses Class.forName() to dynamically load the BidiUtil class.
EB: The line above should be changed to: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4); This change effectively replaces the usage of Class.forName() with direct instantiation of the BidiUtil class.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the win32 implementation of BidiUtil. 
2. Locate the line that uses Class.forName() to load the BidiUtil class. 
3. Replace that line with the suggested code: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4); 
4. Save and compile the source code. 
5. Run the application and verify that it behaves as expected.
